üá∫üá∏ CATHERINE HERRIDGE: CBS WALKED AWAY FROM ELON BECAUSE THEY COULDN‚ÄôT CONTROL HIM

Catherine revealed CBS  passed on what could have been one of the biggest interviews in modern media, not because Elon refused, but because the network did. 

She said discussions were underway after her work connected to the Twitter Files, and an opportunity emerged to interview Elon live on his own platform. 

That‚Äôs when everything stalled.

‚ÄúI went to the CBS executives and I said, this is the opportunity that we have. 

He‚Äôs saying, I want to do it live and on my platform. 

He‚Äôs one of the most influential human beings on the planet.

And the reaction from the executives was, well, we can‚Äôt do it live. 

And I was like, what do you mean we can‚Äôt do it live?

They said, we don‚Äôt know what he‚Äôs going to say. 

And I‚Äôm thinking, isn‚Äôt that the point of journalism?

They said it has to be taped. 

We have to be able to edit it. It has to be on our platform. 

We have to control the platform.

Everything just got shut down. 

It was one of the biggest interviews you could ever have.

I felt ashamed. I never went back to Elon to say they want to do it, but only if they can control it. 

I couldn‚Äôt do that to someone whose DNA is free speech.‚Äù

üö®üá∫üá∏ DOGE ACCOUNT CONNECTS THE DOTS: FROM BLACK HAWK DOWN TO MINNESOTA FRAUD, 30 YEARS IN THE MAKING

The official DOGE State account just dropped a brutal history lesson.

October 3, 1993. Mogadishu, Somalia. US elite forces, Delta operators and Rangers, drop in for what was supposed to be a 30-minute raid to capture lieutenants of warlord Mohamed Farrah Aidid, who was hijacking UN food aid.

Things went sideways fast.

Somali militias with RPGs blasted two Black Hawk helicopters out of the sky. 

A quick op turned into an 18-hour urban nightmare. 

Block-by-block fighting against thousands.

18 US troops killed. 73 wounded. 

Somali losses in the hundreds.

The worst part: mobs dragged American bodies through the streets, mutilating and parading them on television. 

Images that horrified the world and crushed US public support overnight.

Clinton pulled forces out by 1994.

Then came resettlement. 

Tens of thousands of Somalis brought to the US throughout the '90s. 

Major communities built in Minnesota and Ohio.

Fast forward 30 years.

Those same communities are now ground zero for the largest fraud scandal in American history. 

$9 billion allegedly siphoned from Minnesota alone. 

Daycare schemes. 

Nutrition program fraud. 

Money sent to Kenya and allegedly to Al-Shabaab.

DOGE's point: These policies have consequences that span decades.

From Black Hawk Down to the Quality Learing Center. 

The thread is longer than most realize.

Source: HistoryState, Slate, PBS
Video: @WarMonitorClips

quoted.text:
üö®üá∫üá∏ NICK SHIRLEY: CARTEL SMUGGLING DIDN'T DISAPPEAR WHEN BORDER OPENED, IT JUST CHANGED HANDS

The government started doing what the cartels used to charge for.

Nick Shirley shared what he learned from a former cartel member about how migrant smuggling transformed when the border effectively opened during the Biden administration.

The old system:

"Before all this open border stuff happened, they would smuggle the migrants through secret entry points. 

From there they'd pay a fee to be taken to another city. 

They'd have cartel members here in the United States take them to a safe house, and then the safe house people would help them get on a bus to like New York City or something like that."

What changed wasn't the destination. 

It was who ran the operation.

Under open border policies, the secret crossings became official processing centers. 

The paid transport became taxpayer-funded flights and buses. 

The cartel safe houses became NGO shelters. 

The final destination? Still New York City.

Migrants still paid cartels to get to the border. 

But once they cross, American taxpayers picked up the tab for everything the cartels used to charge for on this side.

Source: @juliandorey @nickshirleyy

RT @MarioNawfal: üö®üá∫üá∏ FRAUD INVESTIGATION SPREADS TO WASHINGTON STATE: DAYCARE WITH 7 KIDS RECEIVED $81,000 IN ONE MONTH

Minnesota. Ohio. N‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
üö®üá∫üá∏ FRAUD INVESTIGATION SPREADS TO WASHINGTON STATE: DAYCARE WITH 7 KIDS RECEIVED $81,000 IN ONE MONTH

Minnesota. Ohio. Now Washington.

Citizen journalist Cam Higby uncovered what appears to be the same playbook operating in Washington State.

Amira Child Care LLC, owned by Ahmed Amira and listed as Somali-speaking, donated $1,000 cash in 2021 to Shukri Olow, a Somali-born candidate for King County Council and Washington State House.

That donation triggered a Public Disclosure Commission investigation.

PDC Case #96266 alleged Olow's campaign accepted contributions exceeding statutory limits. 

The case was closed with a "reminder" after Olow refunded the over-limit portions. 

The PDC noted she was a "first-time candidate." 

The timing and amount, $1,000 in 2021, align with the reported violations.

Now follow the money:

2021-2023: Ahmed Amira Abdi received $383,000 in grants from the Department of Children, Youth and Families.

2023-2025: Amira Child Care LLC received $363,000.

July-November 2025 alone: $355,000. 

December not yet reported.

The math doesn't add up.

Licensed capacity: 12 children. 

Currently enrolled: 7 children.

September 2025 payment: $81,263. 

That's $11,600 per child for one month.

Higby's conclusion: 

"What it appears to be is a child care organization owned by a Somali person donating to Somali political candidates with taxpayer dollars."

Three states. Same pattern. Massive subsidies. 

How deep does this go?

Source: @camhigby / Washington PDC Case #96266

RT @teslaownersSV: üß† Why Neuralink is a game-changer for people with disabilities:
For millions living with paralysis, ALS, or severe motor‚Ä¶

retweet.text:
üß† Why Neuralink is a game-changer for people with disabilities:
For millions living with paralysis, ALS, or severe motor/speech impairment, simple things like using a computer, communicating, or creating are impossible without constant help.
Neuralink‚Äôs brain implant changes that‚Äîletting users control devices purely with thoughts.

Noland, paralyzed below the shoulders from a diving accident, used to rely on a painful mouth stick and family caregivers. Now he independently browses, plays games like Civilization, and studies math, philosophy, & languages daily‚Äîreclaiming his autonomy and planning to return to school.

Alex, quadriplegic after a car crash, lost his passion for designing auto parts. With Neuralink, he‚Äôs back to 3D CAD modeling, graphics, and even coding‚Äîpushing creative boundaries again.

Brad, in late-stage ALS and unable to speak/move, was trapped indoors by unreliable eye-tracking tech. Now he communicates outdoors, attends his kid‚Äôs soccer games, and dreams of travel.

This isn‚Äôt sci-fi. Real patients are already living more independent, connected lives. 
Future steps: robotic arms, speech restoration, even vision.
Neuralink restores dignity, freedom, and hope. It‚Äôs one of the most important advancements for the disabled today.

quoted.text:
Trump admin. halts child care payments nationwide until states provide evidence of legitimate spending | Blake Wolf, One America News Network

The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) announced that the Trump administration is freezing federal child care funding to every single U.S. state after introducing a freeze on Minnesota‚Äôs program ‚Äî in response to ongoing allegations and evidence of widespread fraud.

On Wednesday, HHS spokesperson Andrew Nixon told ABC News that states will receive the funds ‚Äúonly when states prove they are being spent legitimately.‚Äù Future payments now require prior justification, receipts, or photo evidence to verify legitimate spending before funds are released.

The announcement is in response to a report released by independent journalist Nick Shirley last week. Shirley claimed to have exposed $110 million in fraud during his investigation, after going to several daycare centers in Minneapolis, collecting millions in state and federal funds, only to find the locations desolate.

Nixon told the outlet that funding recipients ‚Äúnot suspected of fraudulent activity‚Äù are being instructed to send their ‚Äúadministrative data‚Äù to HHS for review. 

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the onus of the state to make sure that these funds, these federal dollars, taxpayer dollars, are being used for legitimate purposes,‚Äù he continued, noting that funding recipients ‚Äúsuspected of fraudulent activity‚Äù are obligated to provide the federal government with additional documentation such as ‚Äúattendance records, licensing, inspection and monitoring reports, complaints and investigations.‚Äù 

Wednesday‚Äôs announcement follows HHS Deputy Secretary Jim O‚ÄôNeill‚Äôs Tuesday statement pausing all child care payments to the state of Minnesota.

O‚ÄôNeill made the announcement in an X post, announcing three actions the department is taking to root out the ‚Äúblatant fraud that appears to be rampant in Minnesota and across the country.‚Äù 

Explaining the changes, O‚ÄôNeill stated that all Administration for Children & Families (ACF) payments ‚Äúacross America will require a justification and a receipt or photo evidence before we send money to a state.‚Äù 

O‚ÄôNeill went on to demand a comprehensive audit of the Minnesota-based daycare centers, including ‚Äúattendance records, licenses, complaints, investigations, and inspections.‚Äù 

‚ÄúWe have launched a dedicated fraud-reporting hotline and email address at https://t.co/skW0b4R4Ec Whether you are a parent, provider, or member of the general public, we want to hear from you,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúWe have turned off the money spigot and we are funding the fraud.‚Äù 

Alongside additional guardrails placed by HHS, the fraud is being investigated by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the FBI, according to DHS Secretary Kristi Noem and FBI Director Kash Patel. 

‚ÄúHomeland Security Investigations are on the ground in Minneapolis right now conducting a massive investigation on childcare and other rampant fraud,‚Äù Noem wrote in an X post on Monday.

Patel also revealed that the bureau has ‚Äúsurged personnel and investigative resources to Minnesota to dismantle large-scale fraud schemes exploiting federal programs‚Äù on Sunday, going on to discuss the FBI‚Äôs work in securing indictments and convictions in connection to Minnesota‚Äôs $250 million Feeding Our Future fraud scheme. 

‚ÄúThe FBI believes this is just the tip of a very large iceberg. We will continue to follow the money and protect children, and this investigation very much remains ongoing. Furthermore, many are also being referred to immigration officials for possible further denaturalization and deportation proceedings where eligible,‚Äù Patel added.
